etymology.description: 凵 = a hole in the ground; 㐅 indicates the existence or contents (rock/mud/stone/bamboo) in the hole; alternately from the upper component of 㚇.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a pit (凵) with something inside or a mark (㐅) signaling its presence, evoking a concealed hazard. From the idea of a perilous hole, meanings broadened to ‘fierce,’ ‘ominous,’ and ‘unlucky.’

examples.chinese: 警方抓到了凶手(警方抓到了兇手)。
天色阴沉，像有凶兆(天色陰沉，像有凶兆)。
examples.english: The sky looks gloomy, as if there is an ominous sign.

examples.chinese: 这头狼很凶，别靠近(這頭狼很兇，別靠近)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tóu láng hěn xiōng, bié kàojìn.
examples.english: This wolf is fierce; don’t go near.
